title: [marketplace.informatica.com] Profile stored XSS
content:
The user name and lastname are inserted into JS with quotes non-escaped:
Code 89 Bytes
1var pageNameDTM = "%name% %lastname%".replace(/[^a-zA-Z0-9 ]/g, "").replace(/  +/g, " ");
PoC:
Log into your account
Set your name and lastname to "-alert(document.domain)-"
Open your profile page https://marketplace.informatica.com/people/%email% from another account
The script will be executed:
<image_0>
steps: Log into your account and set your name and lastname to "-alert(document.domain)-".
Open your profile page from another account at https://marketplace.informatica.com/people/%email% to execute the script.
vuln_description: The user name and lastname are inserted into JavaScript without proper escaping, allowing for stored XSS when another user views the profile page.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward XSS injection through user profile fields, which is a common and well-documented attack vector. The steps to reproduce are simple and do not require complex interactions or state manipulation.

authnz_metadata.reason: The vulnerability involves a stored XSS where user input (name and lastname) is inserted into JavaScript without proper escaping. This is not directly related to authentication or authorization (AuthN/AuthZ) but rather a client-side input validation and output encoding issue. The proposed methodologies focus on testing AuthN/AuthZ boundaries by swapping user sessions and resource IDs, which does not apply to XSS vulnerabilities.
